original: Leijonhufvud, Broder Abraham Axel Stensson, friherre, kammarherre, godsägare, Snappahem, f. 6/7/94 i Kalmar av översten, frih. Sten L. o. grev:an Hanna Elisabeth Hedvig Charlotta Le-wenhaupt. — Stud:ex. i Sthlm 13, jur. kand. 20. Not. v. Jösse hds doms. 21, attaché hon. v. sv. beskickn. i Haag 23, äger Lidhems egendom i Kronob. län samt fastigh. i Sthlm sed. 24 resp. 29. Stud:resor t. Tyskl., Engl., Frankr. m. fl. länder samt i Schweiz 22, Turk., Grekl. o. Ital. 25, Egypten 39. RJohO, RNedONO.
translated: Leijonhufvud, Brother Abraham Axel Stensson, Baron, Chamberlain, Landowner, Snappahem, born on July 6, 1894 in Kalmar. Son of Colonel, Baron Sten L. and Countess Hanna Elisabeth Hedvig Charlotta Le-wenhaupt. Completed his high school studies in Stockholm in 1913 and obtained a law degree in 1920. Served as a law clerk in the Jösse hd court in 1921, and as an attaché at the Swedish mission in The Hague in 1923. Inherited Lidhems estate in Kronoberg County and acquired properties in Stockholm in 1924 and 1929, respectively. Undertook study trips to Germany, England, France, and other countries, as well as Switzerland in 1922, Turkey, Greece, and Italy in 1925, and Egypt in 1939. Knight of the Royal Order of the Seraphim (RJohO) and the Royal Nassau Order of Orange-Nassau (RNedONO).
